message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.DS, cs.MA, cs.GT. 

The paper proposes a model of heteroscedastic linear bandits with reneging, which is a problem in sequential decision making. This suggests that the paper could belong to several sub-categories, including machine learning (cs.LG), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), data structures and algorithms (cs.DS), multi-agent systems (cs.MA), and game theory (cs.GT). Among these, machine learning and artificial intelligence are the most likely sub-categories, as they are closely related to sequential decision making and bandit problems. Data structures and algorithms and multi-agent systems are also relevant, as they involve optimization and decision making in complex systems. Game theory is less likely, as it is more focused on strategic interactions between agents rather than individual decision making.
